course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Bridge Engineering
course.description: This course introduces the limit states design method for bridges, discusses the design philosophy and code requirements and presents examples of analysis and design of bridge super-structure components (using the limit states design method).

reviews.author: alienfiretruck
reviews.title: Note that this review is about the PG course CIEM 5380
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers almost everything related to typical bridge design from early planning to construction stage.

Main topics include:
- Site constraints
- Selection of bridge structural form
- Selection of bridge construction method
- Prestressed concrete
- Preliminary bridge dimensioning
- Loading
- Prestressing design
- Bridge accessories
- Arch bridge
- Seismic load
- Ship impact load
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Lee intends to teach the course in a practical way with many real-life examples such as the newly-commissioned TKO Cross Bay Link Bridge.

He also teaches the bridge design process step-by-step to make sure everyone understands. Lecture notes are clear.
reviews.comment_grading: Dr. Lee seems to be satisfied about the performance on the course project, despite not knowing the individual grades of each project submission.
reviews.comment_workload:
The course is 100% graded by the course project, which is separated into three parts:

- Part 1: Appreciation of site constraints (20%)
- Part 2: Selection of bridge structural form and construction method (30%)
- Part 3: Scheme design (50%)

Personally find Part 3 the most challenging because it consists of the most technical items such as bridge dimensioning and prestressing design.

In overall, workload depends on how much effort you put into the coursework.

reviews.author: cdm
reviews.comment_content:
1. Bridge structural form and construction engineering

2. Prestressed Concrete

3. Loadings

4. Analysis

5. Detailing

6. Accessories
reviews.comment_teaching:
I was taught by Dr Barry LEE that year.

The lecture ppts are well-structured.

Hand-written notes of example calculations are uploaded. You can follow the notes to carry out the project.

The project really helps you get a basic idea of the workflow of a simple bridge design (i.e. assigning loads, preliminary sizing, structural analysis, detailing etc.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% Assignment
40% Midterm
40% Project

4%  A+
15% A
28% A-
30% B+
11% B
11% B-
2% C+

Basically good grades are given generously. Only one person got C+.
reviews.comment_workload: In general, the workload is acceptable. No final exam. So you can focus on your project.
